title: Authors and Citation
text: Zoe Khan. Author, maintainer. Callie Murakami. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Khan Z, Murakami C (2025). fishyplots: Plotting Utilities Coastwide Synopsis. R package version 0.1.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fishyplots: Plotting Utilities For Coastwide Synopsis},   author = {Zoe Khan and Callie Murakami},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1}, }

title: Plotting Utilities For Coastwide Synopsis
text: repository collection plotting functions used coastwide synopsis project, led Zoe Khan Callie Murakami.  functions code heavily inspired Fisheries Oceans Canada’s reports Anderson SC, Dunic JC, Keppel EA, Edwards . 2023. data synopsis British Columbia groundfish : 2023 data update. Canadian technical report fisheries aquatic sciences, 1488-5379 ; 3641. Anderson, SC, Keppel, EA, Edwards, . 2021. data synopsis British Columbia groundfish: 2021 data update. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2022/020. vii + 257 p. associated code https://github.com/pbs-assess/gfplot work also building initial NOAA versions (summer 2024) synopsis idea Chantel Wetzel https://github.com/DFO-NOAA-Pacific/gfsynopsis-noaa Matt Callahan https://github.com/MattCallahan-NOAA/gapproductssynopsis Installation:
code: devtools::install_github("DFO-NOAA-Pacific/fishyplots")

what: afsc_bio: Biological data for AFSC survey — afsc_bio
title: afsc_bio: Biological data for AFSC survey — afsc_bio
text: Contains biological data AFSC surveys availible top species defined data-raw/afsc_top.rds.

title: afsc_bio: Biological data for AFSC survey — afsc_bio
code: afsc_bio

title: afsc_bio: Biological data for AFSC survey — afsc_bio
text: data frame 485258 rows 10 variables: region region data collection survey subregion year year specimen collected common_name common name specien scientific_name scientific name specimen sex specimen sex, M, F, U (unknown) length_cm length specimen, cm weight_kg weight specimen, kg age_years age specimen, years depth_m Depth meters

what: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
title: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
text: Plots distribution ages across survey years.

title: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
code: age_frequency(   data,   subregions,   common,   sex = FALSE,   cutoff = 0.95,   facet_all = TRUE )

title: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
text: data biological fisheries data containing age sex information subregions choose NWFSC, PBS, AK Gulf, /AK BSAI common species common name sex TRUE FALSE want differentiate sex cutoff define cutoff grouping older ages together facet_all TRUE facet surveys regardless missing data, FALSE region(s) data faceted

title: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
text: ggplot object

title: Plots distribution of ages across survey years. — age_frequency
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("nwfsc_bio") data("afsc_bio") data("pbs_bio") all_data <- bind_rows(afsc_bio, nwfsc_bio, pbs_bio)  age_frequency(all_data, c("PBS", "NWFSC", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"), "yellowtail rockfish") } # }

what: ak_survey_lengths: length count data from AFSC surveys — ak_survey_lengths
title: ak_survey_lengths: length count data from AFSC surveys — ak_survey_lengths
text: Contains biological length counts AFSC surveys available top species defined data-raw/afsc_top.rds, separated survey group. Compiled large external dataset. Filtering can found data-raw/filter_ak_lengths.R

title: ak_survey_lengths: length count data from AFSC surveys — ak_survey_lengths
code: ak_survey_lengths

title: ak_survey_lengths: length count data from AFSC surveys — ak_survey_lengths
text: data frame 1158 rows 5 variables: year year data collection survey subregion group within AFSC: AK GULF (Gulf Alaska) AK BSAI (Bering Sea Aleutian Islands) common_name common name specien scientific_name scientific name specimen length.count number lengths taken specimen survey year

what: all_catch: Catch data (occurrences) for all surveys/regions — all_catch
title: all_catch: Catch data (occurrences) for all surveys/regions — all_catch
text: Contains catch data surveys/regions available top species. Catch data pulled packages nwfscSurvey surveyjoin

title: all_catch: Catch data (occurrences) for all surveys/regions — all_catch
code: all_catch

title: all_catch: Catch data (occurrences) for all surveys/regions — all_catch
text: data frame 4052 rows 8 variables: region region data collection survey subregion common_name common name specimen scientific_name scientific name specimen year year tows conducted n_tows total number tows conducted n_pos number positive tows proportion_pos proportion total tows positive

what: Dataset of design based biomass indices for all science centers — all_dbi
title: Dataset of design based biomass indices for all science centers — all_dbi
text: Joined data design based biomass estimates calculated separately science center

title: Dataset of design based biomass indices for all science centers — all_dbi
code: all_dbi

title: Dataset of design based biomass indices for all science centers — all_dbi
text: data frame 4154 rows 8 columns: region Research center gathered data survey_group Grouping surveys used shiny app survey survey data collected common_name Common name specimen collected scientific_name Scientific name specimen collected year Year specimen collected est Estimated design-based biomass lwr Lower confidence interval biomass estimation upr Upper confidence interval biomass estimation

what: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
title: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
text: Function modeled CPUE map based prediction data

title: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
code: fishmap(data, subregion = c("NWFSC", "PBS", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"), common_name)

title: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
text: data prediction data fishfit scripts subregion choose AK BSAI, AK GULF, PBS, NWFSC common_name species common name

title: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
text: ggplot object

title: Function for modeled CPUE map based on prediction data — fishmap
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(predictions_afsc) data(predictions_pbs) data(predictions_nwfsc) data <- bind_rows(predictions_afsc, predictions_pbs, predictions_nwfsc)  fishmap(data, c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "PBS", "NWFSC"), "arrowtooth flounder") fishmap(data, "PBS", "dover sole") } # }

what: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
title: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
text: Function plot length frequency fish species

title: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
code: length_frequency(   data,   subregions,   common,   time_series = TRUE,   facet_all = TRUE )

title: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
text: data biological fisheries data containing length information subregions choose NWFSC, PBS, AK Gulf, /AK BSAI common species common name time_series TRUE FALSE facet_all TRUE facet surveys regardless missing data, FALSE region(s) data faceted

title: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
text: ggplot object

title: Function to plot length frequency of fish species — length_frequency
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(nwfsc_bio) data(afsc_bio) data(pbs_bio) nwfsc_bio <- nwfsc_bio |> select(-otosag_id) all_data <- rbind(nwfsc_bio, afsc_bio, pbs_bio)  length_frequency(all_data, c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "PBS", "NWFSC"), "arrowtooth flounder")  } # }

what: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
title: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
text: Main function plot mean lengths time sex

title: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
code: length_ts(data, species)

title: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
text: data region bio data plotted. Preload data file, see examples. species common scientific name target species

title: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
text: time series plot mean lengths sex

title: Main function to plot mean lengths over time by sex — length_ts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("nwfsc_bio") data("pbs_bio") data("afsc_bio") akgulf_bio <- afsc_bio %>% filter(survey == "AK GULF") akbsai_bio <- afsc_bio %>% filter(survey == "AK BSAI") all_data <- bind_rows(akgulf_bio, akbsai_bio, nwfsc_bio, pbs_bio)  length_ts(all_data, "arrowtooth flounder") length_ts(akgulf_bio, "atka mackerel") } # }

what: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
title: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
text: Main function plot length-weight relationships sex

title: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
code: length_weight(data, species, subset = TRUE)

title: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
text: data region bio data plotted. Preload data file, see examples. species common scientific name target species subset default TRUE faster plotting subset n = 10000. Set FALSE available data.

title: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
text: plot sexed data log-log regression slope intercept

title: Main function to plot length-weight relationships by sex — length_weight
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("nwfsc_bio") data("pbs_bio") data("afsc_bio") akgulf_bio <- afsc_bio %>% filter(survey == "AK GULF") akbsai_bio <- afsc_bio %>% filter(survey == "AK BSAI") all_data <- bind_rows(akgulf_bio, akbsai_bio, nwfsc_bio, pbs_bio)  length_weight(all_data, "arrowtooth flounder") length_weight(akgulf_bio, "atka mackerel", subset = FALSE) } # }

title: lw_vb_fit_doc: Documentation of lw and vb predictions — lw_predictions

title: Function for age-depth plot — plot_age_depth
text: Function age-depth plot

title: Function for age-depth plot — plot_age_depth
code: plot_age_depth(   data,   subregion = c("NWFSC", "PBS", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"),   common,   by_sex = FALSE )

title: Function for age-depth plot — plot_age_depth
text: data biological data subregion choose PBS, NWFSC, AK BSAI, AK GULF common species common name by_sex show sex differentiation

title: Function for age-depth plot — plot_age_depth
text: ggplot object

title: Function for age-depth plot — plot_age_depth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(afsc_bio) data(pbs_bio) data(nwfsc_bio) all_data <- bind_rows(afsc_bio, pbs_bio, nwfsc_bio) plot_age_depth(all_data, c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "PBS", "NWFSC"), "arrowtooth flounder") } # }

what: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
text: Function formatted data plot design based index

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
code: plot_dbi(species, surveys)

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
text: species common scientific name species interest. See examples options per dataset. surveys surveys survey group, required specify servey/region plotted. See examples options per dataset.

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
text: ggplot object, plot design based indicies

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # To see options for species and surveys in regions: "NWFSC", "AFSC", "PBS" data(all_dbi)  all_dbi %>% filter(region == "AFSC") %>%  distinct(common_name)  all_dbi %>% filter(region == "AFSC") %>% distinct(survey)    # usage examples plot_dbi("sablefish", "U.S. West Coast") plot_dbi("dover sole", "U.S. Gulf of Alaska") plot_dbi("arrowtooth flounder", "SYN QCS") } # }

what: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
title: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
text: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions

title: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
code: plot_growth(data, predictions, subregions, common, facet_all = TRUE)

title: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
text: data biological data containing age, length, sex information predictions von Bertalanffy prediction data /data folder subregions choose NWFSC, PBS, AK Gulf, /AK BSAI common species common name facet_all TRUE facet surveys regardless missing data, FALSE region(s) data faceted

title: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
text: ggplot object

title: plot von Bertalanffy function predictions — plot_growth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(vb_predictions) data(pbs_bio) data(afsc_bio) data(nwfsc_bio) data <- bind_rows(pbs_bio, afsc_bio, nwfsc_bio)  plot_growth(data, vb_predictions, "AFSC", "walleye pollock") plot_growth(data, vb_predictions, c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "NWFSC", "PBS"), "arrowtooth flounder") } # }

what: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
title: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
text: Main function display survey specimen counts

title: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
code: survey_table(data, species, form = 2)

title: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
text: data data frame bio data species species interest common scientific name form choose 1 tibble 2 ggplot

title: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
text: tibble ggplot object

title: Main function to display survey specimen counts — survey_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("nwfsc_bio") data("pbs_bio") data("afsc_bio") akgulf_bio <- afsc_bio |> filter(survey == "AK GULF") akbsai_bio <- afsc_bio |> filter(survey == "AK BSAI") all_data <- bind_rows(akgulf_bio, akbsai_bio, nwfsc_bio, pbs_bio)   survey_table(akgulf_bio, "atka mackerel", form = 1) survey_table(nwfsc_bio, "sebastes zacentrus", form = 2) survey_table(pbs_bio,"arrowtooth flounder", form = 2) survey_table(all_data, "arrowtooth flounder") } # }
